properties.areaDesc: Wabash, IL; Daviess, IN; Knox, IN; Gibson, IN; Pike, IN
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 7 at 10:00AM EST until January 8 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Indianapolis IN
properties.description:
...A Flood Warning continues for portions of the following waterways
in Indiana...

White River...


.Lowland flooding continued on the lower White River Tuesday
morning.  The flooding is expected to end by early Tuesday afternoon
at Petersburg, and Wednesday night at Hazleton.

A strong storm system is expected to bring copious rainfall to
Indiana starting late Thursday and ending Saturday night. The time
period of heaviest rainfall will likely be from Friday evening to
Saturday evening.  Today's river forecasts do not yet capture the
predicted rainfall from this system.

The Flood Warning continues for
The White River at Petersburg.
* until late tonight.
* At 8:30 AM Tuesday the stage was 16.2 feet.
* Flood stage is 16.0 feet.
* Forecast...It will continue to fall to below flood stage by this
afternoon.
* At 16.0 feet...Flooding affects agricultural lands.
properties.instruction:
Precautionary/Preparedness Actions...

Motorists should never drive into flood water. Turn around and go
another way. Keep children away from flooded areas. Recreational and
agricultural interests should remain alert to changing river
conditions.

For detailed flood information go to weather.gov/ind on the web and
click on rivers and lakes.
